name: Pumpkin Ravioli with Creamy Crab Sauce
author: FYRECRACKER
summary: In grocery stores across the country, frozen and fresh pumpkin raviolis are popping up and selling like hot cakes. The only question is: What kind of sauce do you put on them?  I've got a creamy and light crab sauce with a touch of Parmesan and thyme that will blow your mind! Sprinkle with extra cheese, garnish with a sprig of fresh thyme, and enjoy!
ingredients: salt and ground white pepper to taste
directions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Stir in ravioli and return to a boil
Cook uncovered, stirring occasionally, until ravioli float to the top and filling is hot, 6 to 8 minutes
Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat
Add crabmeat and thyme; cook and stir until thyme is fragrant, about 2 minutes
Increase heat to medium-high and cook, stirring, until cream begins to steam, 4 to 5 minutes
Reduce heat and add Parmesan cheese; stir until melted, about 2 minutes
Ladle cream sauce into the bottom of a serving dish; top with ravioli
